{"step_by_step_thinking": "Neoplasia refers to the process that results in the formation of a neoplasm or tumor. It involves abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth. When this occurs in the blood vessels, it is specifically referred to as an angioma. Hematoma is a collection of blood outside of a blood vessel. Lymphosarcoma is a malignant tumor (cancer) that arises from lymphocytes, a type of white blood cell. Papilloma is a benign, noncancerous tumor that grows in epithelial tissue and usually forms a small, wart-like growth.", "answer_choice": "A. Angioma"}
